Showers early then partly cloudy overnight PERIOD Low around 50F PERIOD Winds S at  to  mph PERIOD Chance of rain  PERIOD

Updated November     pm





A Seattle Police Department officer responds to an incident near campus May   PERIOD

The UWPD is doubling its patrol presence in the Greek community in response to the recent spike in assaults and robberies around the UW campus UWPD Assistant Chief Ralph Robinson said yesterday PERIOD

Four officers will now patrol the areas north of campus on five nights per week PERIOD Officers will also be on patrol Sundays and Mondays days during which the UWPD did not previously patrol PERIOD

 Robinson said PERIOD

UW police sent an email to members of the community Tuesday night detailing two more attacks  the fourth and fifth of the month PERIOD

 according to the email PERIOD 

Officials at the Seattle Police Department could not be reached to comment on how they plan to utilize the extra resources PERIOD

Despite the upsurge of violence Robinson said that in the UDistrict and Greek community as a whole crime has gone down in the last couple of years PERIOD

 he said PERIOD

In an email to The Daily Teresa Lord Hugel Executive Director of the Greater University Chamber of Commerce acknowledged that the recent crime notification emails make it seem as though crime is increasing but that may not actually be the case because there has always been some level of crime in the community PERIOD

 she said PERIOD

On Jan PERIOD  a victim was walking northbound on the  block of seventeenth Avenue Northeast when two male suspects asked to use his phone according to the email alert PERIOD When the victim refused the suspects hit him with a fist and stole his backpack PERIOD

Seattle police are also investigating a Jan PERIOD  robbery on Northeast forty-fifth Street and ninth Avenue Northeast when two male suspects approached the victim demanded money and struck him in the face taking the victims wallet and  cash PERIOD

It is unclear whether the crimes are related PERIOD

In addition to increasing patrols Robinson said the UWPD is making efforts to reach out to the community PERIOD Tonight police will meet with UW officials and members of the Greek community in a closed meeting at the Beta Theta Pi fraternity house on the corner of seventeenth Avenue Northeast and Northeast forty-seventh Street to talk about how to stay safe Robinson said PERIOD

A member of the Beta Theta Pi fraternity house was assaulted with a gun outside of the house just  days ago said a spokesperson for the Interfraternity Council PERIOD

 Robinson said PERIOD 

Reach reporter Maks Goldenshteyn at newsdailyuw.com PERIOD
